intro: Iris gaditana, commonly known as the Spanish iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring sword-shaped leaves and a tall, slender stem. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in moist, well-drained soils, often found near water bodies. Iris gaditana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
